result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Amy Menzel dated November 2, 2022 re: request to reschedule to plea/sentencing with the co-defendant's case
Motion hearing on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Motion hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Menzel dated September 1, 2022 re: Request for adjournment
Motion hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-Trial Status Report
to Suppress Fruits of Vehicle Search
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:10 AM Defendant HEATHER M LANCASTER appeared by video.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amy Lynn Menzel appeared by video for HEATHER M LANCASTER.  Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Def states she will waive her rights to a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Menzel acknowledges receipt of the information, confirms it mirrors the complaint, and waives any reading. Atty Menzel enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at  10:13 AM.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Not to possess any firearms. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Letter to the Court from Atty Menzel dated March 11, 2022 re: zoom request
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Not to possess any firearms. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.                        (incorrect date on the bottom)
Not to possess any firearms. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:31 AM Defendant HEATHER M LANCASTER appeared in court, Attorney Amy Lynn Menzel appeared in court for HEATHER M LANCASTER, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Menzel confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Not to possess any firearms. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. 

Court adjourned at  9:34 AM.

Court will set for Status of Prelim April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Amy from Atty Menzel's office called and stated Atty Menzel would be unavailable for the defendant's Initial Appearance set for Jan 25, 2022 at 9:00 AM. Amy was told to submit something in writing requesting this adjournment. Amy requested a court date of March 8, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
